title: Hawk & golfing, Wild of the Week: Chicago outdoors, Sunday notes
text:
No, I do not mean Ken “Hawk” Harrelson and golfing, though he was/is a noted golfer. Well, you see what I mean.
Led by Wild of the Week, Sunday notes from the Sun-Times outdoors page .
FIELD NOTES
WILD OF THE WEEK
At George W. Dunn National last month, Ron Wozny encountered this hawk, then emailed, “He was pissed we made him move before he could get his chipmunk for lunch.’’
Send WOTW nominations on Facebook (Dale Bowman), Twitter (@BowmanOutside) or by email (straycasts@sbcglobal.net).
WILD TIMES
HUNTER SAFETY
Nov. 6-7: Elburn, phil-joanne@juno.com
DUCKS UNLIMITED
Thursday: Salt Creek-Hinsdale dinner, Hinsdale Golf Course, Clarendon Hills. Contact Chris Hildreth , (312) 543-8587; Scott Lundmark , (630) 841-8642
PHEASANTS FOREVER
Friday: Kane County banquet, Lincoln Inn, Batavia. Contact John Konen , (630) 205-2492
FISH GATHERINGS
Monday: Mark Lutz on kayak fishing, Oswegoland Fishin’ Fools, Allied First Bank Building, Oswego, 7 p.m., fishinfools.org
Thursday: Harry Vopicka on marine engines, Riverside Fishing Club, LaGrange American Legion, 6:30 p.m., RiversideFishingClub.com
WINGSHOOTING CLINICS
Oct. 17-18: St. Charles Sportsmen’s Club, Elburn, (630) 363-6180
ILLINOIS SEASONS
Oct. 10-11: Youth waterfowl hunt, north zone
Oct. 10-Oct. 12: Youth firearm deer season
DALE’S MAILBAG
E: “Our family would go fossil and houby hunting and pick apples and black walnuts in the fall [around Braidwood]. We’d always make time to go to Wilmington and stop at the [now-closed] Launching Pad Drive-In for ice cream. Your article brought back a lot of good childhood memories.’’ Jim Hantak , Hillside
A: Houby is Czech for mushroom.
BIG NUMBER
39.25: Inches of the longest muskie in the PMTT Ranger Boats World Championship on Wisconsin’s Lake Wissota; which Cesar Saucedo , Mundelein, and Ric Cummings , Vernon Hills, won
LAST WORD
“The Izaak Walton League believes that providing outdoor recreation opportunities is critical to maintaining public health as well as public support for our natural resources.’’
Mike Leahy , IWL conservation director, on the necessity of Congress reauthorizing the Land and Water Conservation Fund
